intro: Pinus montana subf. pendula, commonly known as the weeping mountain pine, is a variant of the mountain pine characterized by its distinctive cascading foliage. This subspecies features long, pendulous shoots that give it a unique, flowing appearance. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly the Alps. The needles are typically blue-green in color and grow in clusters of five. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking visual form.
